|nanori=あかし, あかね, あかり, いろ, かのう, くう, くれ, くれい, くれお, くれな, くれん, まどか, れな

subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
[[File:Solid kurenai.svg|thumb|150px|{{lang|ja|紅}} (''kurenai'', ''beni'', ''kō''): hexadecimal color code #D71345]] [[File:Safflower.jpg|thumb|150px|{{lang|ja|紅}} (''kurenai'', ''beni''): the [[safflower]], ''Carthamus tinctorius'']]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くれない}} {{IPAfont|⟨kure no2 awi⟩}} → {{IPAchar|/kurenawi/}} → {{IPAchar|/kurenai/}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=くれない|-}}. Shift from {{m|ja|呉の藍|tr=Kure no ai}}:{{R:Daijisen}} {{compound|ja|sort=くれない|呉|tr1=Kure|t1=China|の|tr2=no|pos2=possessive particle|藍}} (''ai'', “[[indigo]]”: by extension, “[[dye]]”). The [[safflower]], from which the [[crimson]] dye was extracted, was brought to Japan from China.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|くれない|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Proverbs
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|紅は園%生に植えても隠れなし|くれない は その%う に うえて も かくれ なし|[[safflower]] [[stand]]ing out in a [[garden]] does not [[hide]] → a [[superior]] [[person]] [[attract]]s [[attention]]}}
* {{ja-r|柳は緑 花は紅|やなぎ は みどり はな は くれない|[[willow]]s are [[green]], [[flower]]s are [[red]] → [[natural]]; [[world]] is [[different]]}}

subSections.title: Proper noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
[[File:DiorLippenstift.jpg|thumb|150px|{{lang|ja|紅}} (''beni''): [[lipstick]]]] [[File:2006_Mac_Limited_Edition_Patternmaker_POWDER_BLUSH.jpg|thumb|150px|{{lang|ja|紅}} (''beni''): [[rouge]]]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|べに}} {{IPAfont|*/peni/}} → {{IPAchar|/beni/}} First attested in ''{{w|The Pillow Book}}'', completed in 1002. Shift from *''heni'', attested in the ''{{w|Wamyō Ruijushō}}'' (938 {{CE}}) with the original sense of "[[rouge]]". The ''ni'' is definitely {{m|ja|丹|tr=ni||[[red earth]], [[cinnabar]]}}, while the initial ''pe''/''be'' remains uncertain.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|べに|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Idioms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|紅をさす|べに を さす|[[apply]] [[crimson]] (in [[face]] or using a [[lipstick]]) → [[blush]]; [[flush]]; to [[go red]] in the face, as from [[shame]] or [[anger]]}}

subSections.title: Proper noun
Etymology 3
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|あか|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|あか}}

# {{altspell|lang=ja|赤|tr=aka||[[red]]}}

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The {{m|ja||紅}} spelling for ''aka'' carries connotations of a [[deep]]er red or [[crimson]] color.

subSections.title: Proper noun
subSections.text:
